instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.BUTTON_DISABLE: What is BUTTON_DISABLE? BUTTON_DISABLE disables the trackpad when SMC_LID is below 0.5v and the system believes the lid is closed. .
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.USB_TPAD_P: What is USB_TPAD_P? USB_TPAD_P is the positive signal in a USB data signal transferring keyboard & trackpad use to the CPU from the trackpad. .
definitions.USB_TPAD_N: What is USB_TPAD_N? USB_TPAD_N is the positive signal in a USB data signal transferring keyboard & trackpad use to the CPU from the trackpad. .

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Keyboard & Trackpad
threads.message:
Hello Jhon here again. I have macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> has no keyboard and trackpad.
Pin 4 =3.4V
Pin 30 =3.3V
PP3V3 _S3_PSOC = 3.3V
If RIO Flex Connected that is the error shown on the screen. Thanks for the help.

br,
sulitunlock

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Keyboard & Trackpad
threads.message:
Check the resistors around <CHIP>U4801</CHIP>.
Be sure <SIGNAL>BUTTON_DISABLE</SIGNAL> is 0V.

Ant history available?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Keyboard & Trackpad
threads.message:
It was no power due to <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S0_CPUVR_VIN</SIGNAL> had corossion I just clean and it power on.

<SIGNAL>BUTTON_DISABLED</SIGNAL> is 0v sir
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> 3.4V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3_PSOC</SIGNAL> = Present

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Keyboard & Trackpad
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R4801</RESISTOR>-04 all good?
Post diode mode to ground and voltage at <SIGNAL>USB_TPAD_P</SIGNAL>/N lines.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Keyboard & Trackpad
Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Keyboard & Trackpad
threads.message:
Voltages look good, but diode mode difference a bit high.
Try changing <CHIP>U4801</CHIP>; better to use donor board.
